respStmt.resp: Encoded in TEI P5 XML by
respStmt.name: Danny Smith

availability.p: The Global Medieval Sourcebook is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

projectDesc.p: "The Queen of France" is published by The Global Medieval Sourcebook (GMS), a free, open access, and open source compendium of medieval texts in their original languages and in English translation. GMS comprises computer-readable transcriptions or editions alongside new translations of texts dating from the ninth to the sixteenth century and originating in Europe, North Africa, the Middle East, and Asia. The GMS platform includes critical introductions as well as sources for further reading.

editorialDecl.p: Transcriptions and translations are encoded in XML conforming to TEI (P5) guidelines. The original-language text is contained within <lem> tags and translations within <rdg> tags.

interpretation.p: Texts are translated into modern American English with maximum fidelity to the original text, except where it would impair comprehension or good style. Archaisms are preserved where they do not conflict with the aesthetic of the original text. Scribal errors and creative translation choices are marked and discussed in the critical notes.

app.lem: Des konings boich von franckrich geit hijr ain
app.rdg: The story of the King of France is being told here

app.lem: *D*Ye schrijfft bedudet so waz geschach
app.rdg: *T*his text tells what happened

app.lem: Daz man yn hoger eren sach
app.rdg: when a fine king of France

app.lem: Von franckrich eynnen koninck guet
app.rdg: rose to high esteem.

app.lem: Der waz vor wandel wail behuit
app.rdg: He was flawless.

app.lem: Der selbe herre hat grois huiß ere
app.rdg: The household honor of this very lord was great.

app.lem: Er hat eyn mynnencliches wijff
app.rdg: He had a lovely wife.

app.lem: Naich wvnschen waz gestalt ir lijff
app.rdg: She was so beautiful,

app.lem: Zuchtich vnde bescheyden
app.rdg: virtuous, and modest

app.lem: Daz sij nyeman mochte verleyden
app.rdg: that no one could despise her;

app.lem: Wer sij myt augen ain gesach
app.rdg: whoever had seen her with his own eyes,

app.lem: Dat er yr jn hoger eren jach
app.rdg: held her in the highest esteem.

app.lem: [Der künig hette ein marschalg]
app.rdg:
[Now the king had a marshal.]
Line 11a was taken from Strippel because the rhyme scheme and the subsequent text talk about an unknown “er”; it looks like the scribe made a mistake and forgot to copy this line (p. 213, l.13).

app.lem: Den moyst man forten ouer all
app.rdg: Everyone had to fear him everywhere,

app.lem: Alles daz er geboyt
app.rdg: And everything that he ordered

app.lem: Da von die koningynnen qwam // yn noit
app.rdg: Because of him, the queen faced great hardship

app.lem: Want dye koningynnen
app.rdg: because he begged her

app.lem: Dye bat er vmb dye mynne
app.rdg: for her love,

app.lem: Want hey ir dick heymlichen waz
app.rdg: as he often met with her in private.

app.lem: Myt eren sij doch vor yeme genaß
app.rdg: She overcame him with her honor,

app.lem: Daz sij durch falsche bede
app.rdg: for such a treacherous plea

app.lem: Nye ouell dayt gedede
app.rdg: would never make her commit such an evil deed,

app.lem: Want sij versagede yeme dogen // clich
app.rdg: and she refused him as she should.

app.lem: Zu yeme so sprach dye mynnenclich
app.rdg: The lovely lady said to him:

app.lem: War vmb mudes du myr dez
app.rdg: “How can you imagine such a thing of me?

app.lem: Du weyß doch woil wez durch // weß
app.rdg: You know full well

app.lem: Willen du daz laissen salt
app.rdg: on whose account you must desist:

app.lem: Myn herre der ist dijr also holt
app.rdg: on account of my lord, who holds you in such high esteem.

app.lem: Er hat gesat yn dyne hant
app.rdg: He has placed in your hands

app.lem: Burge stede vnde wijde lant
app.rdg: castles, cities, and wide lands,

app.lem: Durch daz du syn geweldich bist
app.rdg: and put you in charge of them.

app.lem: Durch got layß mich ain argelist
app.rdg: For the sake of Our Lord, spare me your malicious tricks

app.lem: Belyuen vnd bede mich nit me
app.rdg: and do not ask me again

app.lem: Daz myr gee ain myne ere
app.rdg: for anything that compromises my honor.”

app.lem: *D*Er marschalck vngetruwe sprach
app.rdg: *T*he faithless marshal said:

app.lem: Myr ist vmmer nuwee
app.rdg: “The torment and suffering of my heart

app.lem: Vngemach vnd hertzen leyt
app.rdg:
are renewed daily.
The syntax has been changed in the English translation for clarity of meaning.

app.lem: Auch hain ich ain vnderscheit
app.rdg: What’s more, I have loved you ceaselessly

app.lem: Gedynet von kindez yogent
app.rdg: since I was young.

app.lem: Nu laissent mich uwer dogen
app.rdg: Now let me enjoy a secret affair with you

app.lem: Geneyssen vnd horent mich
app.rdg: and grant me my pleas,

app.lem: Vill zarte frauwe mynnenclich
app.rdg: dearest, beloved lady.”

app.lem: *D*O sprach die zarte mynnenclich
app.rdg: *T*he lovely and sweet one replied:

app.lem: Jch nemen is uff die true myn
app.rdg: “On my honor, I swear,

app.lem: Erlaysse mich deser bede
app.rdg: spare me this request

app.lem: Ee dan daz ich dich erwede
app.rdg: or I promise

app.lem: Brenghe jn leyt vnd vngemach
app.rdg: to inflict on you pain and trouble.”

app.lem: Der marschalg gedohte
app.rdg: The marshal thought:

app.lem:
O avee und owach
“sprach” at the end of line 46 was substituted by “gedohte” taken from Strippel because the subsequent text makes clear that the marshal would never talk about his evil thoughts before taking leave of the queen (p. 220, l. 48); she is ignorant of his evil intentions.
app.rdg: “Oh, woe is me! Alas!

app.lem: Leget sij is mynem herren vor
app.rdg: If she passes this on to my lord,

app.lem: So weyß ich wail daz ich verlore
app.rdg: I know for certain that I will lose

app.lem: Lijff ere vnde alle myn guet
app.rdg: my life, my honorable position at court, and all my possessions.”

app.lem: Da myt der marschalk von ir schiet
app.rdg: With this the marshal took leave of her,

app.lem: Vnde ginck gedencken euen
app.rdg: and he left thinking about

app.lem: Wie er dye fraue brecht vmb ir // leuen
app.rdg: how to take the lady’s life.

app.lem: *D*Er koningk eyns seden plach
app.rdg: *T*he king was in the habit of

app.lem: Wanne er schinen sach den // dach
app.rdg: getting up in a noble manner,

app.lem: So stunt er uff von hoger art
app.rdg: at daybreak,

app.lem: Dar lijße von der frauen zart
app.rdg: and leaving the sweet lady

app.lem: Vff daz er sij slayffen lyeß
app.rdg: sleeping there,

app.lem: Als yn syne dogent daz hyeß
app.rdg: as his good manners demanded of him,

app.lem: Want sij waz der iare nyt alt
app.rdg: for she was young.

app.lem: So fore er iagen jn den walt
app.rdg: He went hunting in the woods,

app.lem: Bijssen vnde beyssen
app.rdg: with hunting dogs and with falcons.

app.lem: Der koningk hat auch geheissen
app.rdg: The king had also ordered

app.lem: Daz man besluysse keyn durre
app.rdg: that no door be locked

app.lem: Want der marschalk were dar vor
app.rdg: because the marshal oversaw that.

lem.hi: Also wail getruwet er dem bosewicht

rdg.hi: That is how much he trusted the villain;

lem.hi: Er enwist von syner falscheit nyt

rdg.hi: he knew nothing of his treachery.

app.lem: *D*Er koningk auch erzogen hat
app.rdg: *T*he king had also raised

app.lem: Eyn getwerg ane al missedait
app.rdg: a blameless dwarf,

app.lem: Es lach vnde slyeff jn dem saille
app.rdg: who rested and slept in the great hall.

app.lem: Dez nam der feyge marschalk war
app.rdg: The cowardly marshal took him,

app.lem: Vnde laicht is der frauen jn die arm
app.rdg: put him into the lady’s arms,

app.lem: Vnde decket es sere warm
app.rdg: covered him up

app.lem: Vnde kerde es zu yrrer bruste
app.rdg: and turned him to her breast,

app.lem: Daz sij is werlich nyt enwiste
app.rdg: and she did not notice what was happening.

app.lem: Vnde macht er sich dannen balde
app.rdg: Then he quickly departed

app.lem: Zu deme selbn walde
app.rdg: for the woods,

app.lem: Jn snellicher lijst
app.rdg: full speed,

app.lem: Da er synen herren wiste
app.rdg: where he knew his lord was hunting.

app.lem: *D*O er den koning ain sach
app.rdg: *A*s soon as he spied the king,

app.lem: Vsser faltschem munde er sprach
app.rdg: he spoke deceitful words:

app.lem: Layssent uwer jagen hi belyuen
app.rdg: “Stop your hunting right now.

app.lem: Jr sullent anders bedryuen
app.rdg: You should chase something else,

app.lem: Daz uch nu me zu hertzen gait
app.rdg: that lies closer to your heart

app.lem: Vnde kummerlichen mach werden rait
app.rdg: and that can only with great difficulty be turned from wrong to right.”

app.lem: Der koning sprach waz mach dat // syn
app.rdg: The king said: “What might that be?”

app.lem: Der marschalk sprach de koningynne
app.rdg: The marshal replied: “The queen,

app.lem: Sij pleget falscher mynne
app.rdg: she is an adulteress,

app.lem: Jr sullent nu werden jnne
app.rdg: and you have to see it for yourself.

app.lem: Koment mit mir drade
app.rdg: Come with me quickly,

app.lem: Jr fyndent sij ain faltscher dade
app.rdg: you will catch her in the act of infidelity.”

app.lem: *D*Er koning sere erschrackt
app.rdg: *T*he king was very shocked

app.lem: Jagen er nit langer enplach
app.rdg: and he stopped the hunt.

app.lem: Jn zorne fore er weder heym
app.rdg: Furious, he rode home.

app.lem: Er fant die zarte wandels kein
app.rdg: He found the dearest one as before,

app.lem: Dan noch slayffen ain dem bette
app.rdg: still sleeping in her bed,

app.lem: Vnde sach wo sij hatte
app.rdg: and saw that she had by her side

app.lem: Daz getwerch ain alle schult
app.rdg: the blameless dwarf.

app.lem: Daz nam er mit vngedolt
app.rdg: He lifted the dwarf up swiftly and angrily

app.lem: Alda myt synen henden
app.rdg: with his hands

app.lem: Vnde sluyche is weder dye wende
app.rdg: and slammed him against the wall–

app.lem: Vmb schult da id nye vmb warff
app.rdg: All for a crime that the dwarf never committed–

app.lem: Byß id von synen henden starff
app.rdg: until the king had killed the dwarf.

app.lem: *D*Ye frauwe erwacht vnd sprach
app.rdg: *T*he lady awoke and asked:

app.lem: Here waz ist uwer vngemach
app.rdg: “Sire, what troubles you,

app.lem: Daz yr sijt zornes also voll
app.rdg: that you are so full of anger?”

app.lem: Er sprach du bose schande
app.rdg: He replied: “You worthless disgrace,

app.lem: Du weist doch waill
app.rdg: you know why!

app.lem: Sych wye schenlich du hij lijgest
app.rdg: Look at how shamefully you lie here

app.lem: Vnde mich mit falscheit ouergist
app.rdg: and how you drown me in deceit

app.lem: Myt dyner faltscher mynne
app.rdg: with your adultery!”

app.lem: Herre behaldent uwer synne
app.rdg: “Sire, be reasonable,”

app.lem: Sprach dye edel fraue zart
app.rdg: said the noble and tender lady,

app.lem: Got weyß woil daz ich nye schuldich enwart
app.rdg: “God knows, I am not guilty

lem.hi: So wye es sich auch hait gemacht
Daz muß uch got geuen zu erkennen

rdg.hi: God will unveil the truth to you

lem.hi: Vnd mich von dießer vnschult nemen

note.p: “vnschult” was translated as “schult” because the queen is talking about how God will prove that she is innocent not guilty; “vnschult” seems to be a scribal error.

rdg.hi: and take me from this blame.”

app.lem: Er sprach swich vnd rede nyt
app.rdg: He replied: “Silence! Do not speak!

app.lem: Ich hain ain dyeßer geschiecht
app.rdg: I find this matter

app.lem: Also lesterlichen funden
app.rdg: so degrading

app.lem: Daz du zu dyesen stunden
app.rdg: that you have at this hour

app.lem: Daz leuen moys verloren hain
app.rdg: lost your life,

app.lem: Als balde ich es gefugen kan
app.rdg: as soon as I can bring it about!”

app.lem: *D*O fugede es got daz da bij lach
app.rdg: *N*ow as God designed, there lived nearby

app.lem: Eyn furste der hies hertzoch lupolt
app.rdg: a prince, named Duke Leopold.

app.lem: Als es got fugen wulde
app.rdg: As God had intended,

app.lem: Der erhorte daz gebroche
app.rdg: he heard of the crime.

app.lem: Vnd er waz von dez konings geslecht
app.rdg: He belonged to the royal family,

app.lem: Er waz dez koningx suster kint
app.rdg: he was the king’s sister’s child,

app.lem: Als men noch beschreben fynt
app.rdg: as it is written in the books,

app.lem: Er waz von oysterich genant
app.rdg: and he was from Austria.

app.lem: Er lyeff da er den fursten fant
app.rdg: He hurried to the lord.

app.lem: Er sprach herre was zornent ir
app.rdg: He asked: “Sire, why are you so angry?

app.lem:
durch got daz sult yr sagen mir.
“durch got” at the end of line 134 drifted onto the wrong line. Staying true to the rhyme and for clarity of meaning “durch got” was moved to the beginning of line 135.
app.rdg: In God’s name, tell me.”

app.lem: Do sprach der edel koning rijch
app.rdg: There the noble and highborn king replied:

app.lem: O neue layß erbarmen dich
app.rdg: “Oh nephew, take pity on me!

app.lem: Myn hertzeleyt is also groiß
app.rdg: My heart’s suffering is very great.

app.lem: Sijch wie dye schande ain eren blois
app.rdg: Just look at how this disgrace

app.lem: So lesterlichen geworffen hait
app.rdg: has so degradingly attacked my honor

app.lem: Daz ir nummer mach werden rait
app.rdg: that it can never be made right again.”

app.lem: *D*O sprach der hirtzoch lu // polt
app.rdg: *T*hen Duke Leopold said:

app.lem: So werdent mir nummer holt
app.rdg: “Even though you may never grant me your favor again:

app.lem: Myn fraue nye kein schult gewan
app.rdg: my lady is blameless.

app.lem: Yemant mach sij verraden hain
app.rdg: Someone must have betrayed her;

lem.hi: Want ich nye faltscheit an ir sach

rdg.hi: I have never seen deceit in her.”

app.lem: Der koning myt zorne sprach
app.rdg: The king replied with anger:

app.lem: Sij moyß verbyrnen uff eyner hort
app.rdg: “Let her be burned at the stake!”

app.lem: Neyn sprach der herre erent die frucht
app.rdg: “No”, said the Duke, “honor the child

app.lem: Dye sij yn yrrem lijff dreyt
app.rdg: she carries in her womb.

app.lem: Dodent ir sij es wirt uch leyt
app.rdg: If you kill her it will cause you grief

app.lem: Want ir anders kein erben hait
app.rdg: because you have no other heir.

app.lem: Burge stede vnde wijde lant
app.rdg: Castles, cities, and wide lands

app.lem: Dye yr billich sullont erffen
app.rdg: which you will pass on by right,

app.lem: Willent yr sij verderffen
app.rdg: do you want to ruin all that?

app.lem: *N*Eyn werder herre dont so wail
app.rdg: *N*o, noble Sire, act in such a way

app.lem: Daz ich uch vmmer danck sal
app.rdg: that I will be obliged to you forever:

app.lem: Geuent ir frijst laist sij genesen
app.rdg: let her live until she gives birth,

app.lem: Vff daz ich uwer dyner moge wesen
app.rdg: and I will continue to serve you,

app.lem: Also ich bin gewesten
app.rdg: as I have in the past.

app.lem: Nye kein schult wart so grois // nye
app.rdg: No guilt is so great

app.lem: Da enwer eyn deill genaden ain
app.rdg: that it does not deserve a portion of mercy.

lem.hi: Nu layst sij herre genyessen myn

rdg.hi: Now let her be for my sake, Sire,

app.lem: Vnde ere dy maria die koningynne
app.rdg: and honor the Queen Mary,

app.lem: Dye reyne mait die got gebar
app.rdg: the pure maiden, who gave birth to God,

app.lem: Vnde nement uwer dogent war
app.rdg: and show your virtue

app.lem: Durch ere aller reyner wijff
app.rdg: on behalf of the purest woman,

app.lem: Want sij jn yrrem lijff
app.rdg: because the queen carries in her body

app.lem: Dreyt eyne swere burde
app.rdg: a heavy burden.

app.lem: Jch weyß dat sij nye enwurde
app.rdg: I know that she is not

app.lem: Schuldich ain deser dait
app.rdg: guilty of this misdeed,

app.lem: So wye es sich gefuget hait
app.rdg: however it transpired.”

app.lem: *D*O sprach der koning zu hant
app.rdg: *T*hen the king said quickly:

app.lem: Du weyß wail wie ich sij lijgen fant also lesterlich
app.rdg: “You know very well how I found her lying there, so immorally.

app.lem: Eyn deill wil ich doch eren dich
app.rdg: Yet I will honor you in part:

app.lem: Nym fure sij von den augen myn
app.rdg: Take her, lead her out of my sight

app.lem: Biß sij geberet daz kindelin
app.rdg: until she gives birth to the child.

app.lem: So moyß sij doch verlesen den lijff
app.rdg: After that she must lose her life,

app.lem: Daz geschanten bose wijff
app.rdg: this immoral, wicked wife.”

app.lem: *D*Er hirtzoch von oesterich
app.rdg: *T*he Duke of Austria

app.lem: Nam dye fraue mynnenclich
app.rdg: took the lovely lady

app.lem: Dem koning von den augen sin
app.rdg: out of the king’s sight.

app.lem: Er suechte also wijden hyen
app.rdg: He searched near and far

app.lem: Eynen hoichgeborn man
app.rdg: for a highborn man

app.lem: Der laster noch schande nye ge // wan
app.rdg: who was free from error and vice

app.lem: Der mit gantzer herscher craft
app.rdg: and who had with heroic acts

app.lem: Erworffen hat rijtterschafft
app.rdg: gained knighthood

app.lem: Gantz mit allen synen synen // worden
app.rdg: by being constant in word

app.lem: Stede ain allen orden
app.rdg: and deed everywhere.

app.lem: Dem beuall er dye fraue guet
app.rdg: Into this man’s protection he gave the honorable lady.

app.lem: Er sprach nu haue sij jn diner hude
app.rdg: He told him: “Now protect her

app.lem: Vnde fure sij hyn yn myn lant
app.rdg: and escort her into my land.

app.lem: Biß yr got die gnade hait bekant
app.rdg: When God is merciful to her

app.lem: Daz sij geberet eyn kindelyn
app.rdg: and she bears a child,

app.lem: So saltu nyt langer syn
app.rdg: then do not hesitate:

app.lem: Daz kint saltu brengen mir
app.rdg: bring the child to me,

app.lem: Dye muder laiß hinder dijr
app.rdg: leave the mother behind.”

app.lem: *D*Er rijtter nam die fraue zart
app.rdg: *T*he knight took the sweet lady

app.lem: Dye eme da beuolen wart
app.rdg: who had been consigned to his care.

app.lem: Er furte sij durch eynen wilden dan
app.rdg: He escorted her through a wild evergreen forest.

app.lem: Daz gefrisch der marschalk der bose man
app.rdg: The marshal, the wicked man, discovered this.

app.lem: Der wapende sich
app.rdg: He armed himself

app.lem: Zu hant alda vnde reyt heymlichen na
app.rdg: quickly and rode after them secretly

app.lem: Vnd ermordet den rijtter stolz
app.rdg: and murdered the proud knight.

app.lem: Dye fraue floich in daz holz
app.rdg: The lady fled into the woods.

app.lem: Er furte den rijtter von dem wege
app.rdg: He dragged the knight’s corpse off the path,

app.lem: Vff daz nyeman ensege
app.rdg: so that no one would discover

app.lem: Waz mordez da geschege
app.rdg: that a murder had been committed

app.lem: In der rechter strayssen stege
app.rdg: on the rightful road and path.

app.lem: Wye gerne er ayn der stede
app.rdg: Although he wished

app.lem: Dye koningynnen auch ermordt het
app.rdg: he had also murdered the queen right there and then,

app.lem: Do hatte sij sych verborgen
app.rdg: she had hidden herself.

app.lem: Do reit er heym mit sorgen
app.rdg: He rode home worried

lem.hi: Do er dye fraue nit enfant

rdg.hi: because he could not find the lady.

lem.hi: Do gedaicht er alle zu hant
Daz er yr den lijff neme

app.lem: Der morder der bosewicht
app.rdg: the murderer, the villain.

app.lem: Dye fraue ginge jn leydes plijcht
app.rdg: The lady wandered in anguish

app.lem: Jndem walde da sij waz
app.rdg: through the woods where she found herself.

app.lem: Wurtzelen lauff vnde graß
app.rdg: Roots, leaves and grass,

app.lem: Daz aß sij yn dem walde
app.rdg: that is what she ate in the woods,

app.lem: Daz mynnencliche bilde
app.rdg: this image of loveliness.

app.lem: Sij ginge also lange jn dem dan
app.rdg: She walked for a long time in the evergreen forest,

app.lem: Biß sij zu eynem koler qwam
app.rdg: until she came across a collier.

app.lem: Dye mynnencliche geslachte
app.rdg: The lovely noblewoman

app.lem: Sij fraget yn waz er machte
app.rdg: asked him what he was doing.

app.lem: Er sprach fraue ich birnen kolen
app.rdg: He replied: “Milady, I am burning charcoal.”

app.lem: Sij sprach ist dijr da mit wolle
app.rdg: She asked: “Does this work suit you?”

app.lem: Js macht dijr swartz dinen lijff
app.rdg: “It makes your body all black,”

app.lem: Sprach daz mynnenclijche wijff
app.rdg: said the lovely woman.

app.lem: *D*O sprach der koler sunder haß
app.rdg: *T*he collier replied kindly:

app.lem: Wulde got so hette ichs baß
app.rdg: “If God had wished it things would have been better for me.

app.lem: Nu moyß ich durch hungers noit
app.rdg: Now I am driven by hunger

app.lem: Dys doin biß ain mynen doit
app.rdg: to keep doing this until I die.”

app.lem: Do sprach dye zarte koningynne
app.rdg: The sweet queen said:

app.lem: Wiltu mich layssen bij dir syn
app.rdg: “Will you permit me to stay here with you?

app.lem: Waz du ain fays daz helffen ich dir
app.rdg: I will help you with whatever you undertake.

app.lem: Dez saltu geleuben mir
app.rdg: You can believe what I say.”

app.lem: Do sprach der vil getrue man
app.rdg: The most trustworthy man said:

app.lem: Jch enkan uch leyder nit gedoin
app.rdg: “Alas, I cannot do for you

app.lem: Also yr wail wert weren
app.rdg: what you are certainly worthy of,
